        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>Alice</td>
      <td>24</td>
      <td>LA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>Bob</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>MA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Ofte when working wiht a dataset, you'll want to filter it in different ways. In Pandas, you can easily filter based on a single column:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">age</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">25</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[2]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>Bob</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>MA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>And it isn't much harder to filter based on multiple columns:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">age</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">25</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">state</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'CA'</span><span class="p">)]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Problem">Problem<a class="anchor-link" href="#Problem">¶</a></h1><p>However, I'll often find myself with a large DataFrame that I might want to filter in different ways. Since I'm doing this often, it makes sense to create a function.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">bad_filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">age_threshold</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">state_filter</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">age</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="n">age_threshold</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">state</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">state_filter</span><span class="p">)]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">bad_filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">25</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'CA'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[5]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>However, the problem with this approach is that I might not want to always filter by the same set of columns ever time (<code>age</code> and <code>state</code> in the above example). It would be much nicer if we could simply pass in a dictionary that defines the filtering we want to do.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Flexible-Filtering-in-Pandas">Flexible Filtering in Pandas<a class="anchor-link" href="#Flexible-Filtering-in-Pandas">¶</a></h1><p>I'll present, the function, some examples, and then step through exactly what is happening. The key thing to note is the ability to pass in a dictionary that describes how you want to filter the DataFrame. This is much more flexible since you add / remove columns easily.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">flexible_filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">"""Filter DataFrame using dictionary of filters.</span>
<span class="sd">    </span>
<span class="sd">    Args:</span>
<span class="sd">        df (DataFrame)</span>
<span class="sd">        filters (dict): Mapping of columns (keys) to filter (value)</span>
<span class="sd">    Returns:</span>
<span class="sd">        DataFrame</span>
<span class="sd">    """</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">all</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filtering on a single column</span>
<span class="n">flexible_filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'age'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">31</span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[9]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>Bob</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>MA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Filtering on two columns</span>
<span class="n">flexible_filter</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'age'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">31</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'state'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'CA'</span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[10]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>name</th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>Chris</td>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The function isn't long (just one line!), but there is a lot going on, so let's step through to make sure we understand what is happening.</p>
<p>First, let's identify the columns that the user has decided to filter on:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">filters</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'age'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">31</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'state'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'CA'</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[11]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>['age', 'state']</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Then, we select those columns from the DataFrame:</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>24</td>
      <td>LA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>MA</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>31</td>
      <td>CA</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Cool Trick</strong>: Setting this equal to the Series that maps column names to value, we get the desired boolean values. Pandas is smart enough to know that when you do equality between a DataFrame and a Series, you are comparing along shared indexes (or columns in the case of the DataFrame).</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[14]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">
<div>
<style scoped>
    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {
        vertical-align: middle;
    }

    .dataframe tbody tr th {
        vertical-align: top;
    }

    .dataframe thead th {
        text-align: right;
    }
</style>
<table border="1" class="dataframe">
  <thead>
    <tr style="text-align: right;">
      <th></th>
      <th>age</th>
      <th>state</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th>0</th>
      <td>False</td>
      <td>False</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>1</th>
      <td>True</td>
      <td>False</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <th>2</th>
      <td>True</td>
      <td>True</td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Last (but definitely not least!), we want only rows that consist of all <code>True</code> values. We can easiliy do this using <code>.all(axis=1)</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">)]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Series</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">filters</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">all</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[15]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0    False
1    False
2     True
dtype: bool</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Then, we have the trivial step of passing that boolean Series to the original DataFrame so that it filters the data just to the rows that satisfy all of our filter values.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Next-Steps">Next Steps<a class="anchor-link" href="#Next-Steps">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>There is more we could do with this function, including:</p>
<ul>
<li>Extend to allow OR by passing in list of values in the filtering dictionary</li>
<li>Add ability to use thresholds for numeric columns</li>
</ul>

</div>
